intro: Bidens bigelovii, commonly known as the common tickseed, is an annual flowering plant native to the United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers with ray florets and a central disk. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is often found in the eastern and central regions of North America. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often lobed, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Bidens bigelovii is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
